Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Quote from: Uthred on January 06, 2018, 08:01:26 AM I would want to Know a list of games which is planned for the First release of the platform?  We have not yet stated which games or platform our technology will be integrated with first yet. We have spoken with large and small development companies who are all interested in our technology, but at the moment we are currently focusing on launching our BETA social engagement platform Raid Party, which we be released on mobile for iOS and Android.  After our token sales and we have the funding to build our team and really focus and hone in on our technology, will be able to let you know more about the platforms and games at our technology will be released onto. However it will be down to the development companies to which they integrate our technology into. I am sure if there is a high enough demand for a game, they will integrate our technology.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: We had a very early pre-sale at the start of our project to test the waters if you will. We wanted to gage whether it was worth continuing or not with the project. Our early pre-sale brought in around $75k which has also lead to further larger private investments. This had shown us that if we continue with our project, there is no reason why it couldn't be successful. With the support of our ever growing community, TriForce Tokens is becoming stronger by the day.  The hard cap is $60m. We decided to cap it there as anymore would be unnecessary. $60m is more than enough to execute our plans with room to manoeuvre. Taking anymore than $60m would just be greedy. We are already grateful for our communities support and want to give back what we can, by taking more than we need wouldn't be helping our cause.  You can find more information regarding our stats and figures on our website: https://triforcetokens.io/  If you'd like to know more about our project please feel free to check out our white paper: https://triforcetokens.io/resources/white-paper-v3.3.pdf  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: Zendalet
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Thanks for your response.  I'm unfortunately not that much wiser.   I understand your first point. That the market is big enough for multiple gaming related coins and tokens.  Your second point is... vague. For instance, finding a solution to game piracy, and counterfeit in a broader scope, is one of humanity's biggest puzzles. Please forgive my skepticism about a blockchain startup claiming to provide that which countless DRM companies could not.  It's as you say, I should dig into your white paper, as well as the white papers of other gaming coins and tokens, to get a real answer. Not exactly an elevator pitch then.  But I appreciate the gesture.

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: If I may add to this...  We are fully aware and understand that piracy is not simple nor will it be completely eradicated. No matter what policies, procedure, software, technology etc is put in place, people will find away around it. What we aim to do is to work closely with Coventry University to better understand that root of the problem, why people pirate games. With this knowledge we are able to build our technology to provide a solution that helps minimise piracy by making it more profitable to the pirates whilst making it profitable to the developers where possible. We want to find that balance and fine line to ensure that we provide solutions to the industry that help make an impact, especially for smaller games developers.  Yes there are plenty of other organisations out there that already conduct such research and provide such solutions. But is it working? From the research we have conducted already, punishing someone only leads to further negative behaviour. By pointing out their mistakes and offering them a chance to redeem themselves, people seem to take a more positive approach. Not to mention, we aren't targeting these large development companies, our main target market is that of indie game developers, the underdogs if you will. The developers who lose large amounts of revenue to organisations who simply provide a gateway to consumers. We want to help the underdogs, providing them with new and unexplored revenue streams whilst helping reduce revenue loss through piracy. Thats not to say we won't provide our solutions and technology to the big guys, we are just concentrating our focus and therefore market.  Regarding the white paper, what Pete meant by that was its easy to judge a book by its cover. But until you delve into it and really get into the grit of it, will you really see their true colours. The white paper will allow you to make a true judgement of a project. Websites, banners and social media channels are all designed to look good and entice you, which anyone can do with the know how or the money. But to put together a solid and sound white paper, with real solutions to industry problems, now that takes time, effort and dedication.  Lastly, I understand your scepticism. However, ask yourself this. Why would an internationally recognised institution such as Coventry University put their reputation on the line for a blockchain start up that they don't believe in, baring in mind all of the controversies around it? Our team including myself have pitched our project to and met the director of the university who seemed more than happy to agree a partnership - We must be doing something right.  I hope that has shed some more light on the matter. Please feel free to let us know if anything is unclear or you have any other questions.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: It's ok. At least we have clarified the first issue you had. For the second, you admit you haven't dug deep into other gaming projects, nor ours. What I would say then is, consider Vadim Bulatov who is a head at Wargaming.net (100m+ gamers worldwide). He came across us and immediately understood what challenges we are working to solve (he then joined as an adviser). He is someone that works in this industry and recognised something in us, particularly around the social aspects and fostering positive communities within gaming.  From the conversations and research we have conducted with gamers, developers and industry professionals - we have a unique proposition and a demand (two companies even reached to us to declare their support and interest). Our focus is to now deliver this technology and build the community that will support us in this endeavour, which is going very well.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: The platform as in the social engagement platform will be solely designed for the gaming industry. Although saying that makes it sound small, the gaming industry is huge with tonnes of different channels and avenues. We have lots of ideas of how we can expand the platform making it the place to be for everyone connected to or within the gaming industry.  However other parts of the business and project could potentially spread to other industries as long as they gain enough traction. Such parts would be that of the Anti-Piracy engine.  We are a very broad minded team and are always open to ideas. However at this current stage in time, we need to focus on the task at hand first and get this right before getting distracted with other ideas.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: Zendalet
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: I mean no disrespect, but by now there are a hundred gaming related coins and tokens. Some of which have already partnered up with major industry players. What is different about TriForce and how will TriForce tokens survive among the competing gaming tokens?

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Hi Zendalet,  It's ok, it's a fair question to raise . Also please don't take our response as a challenge either, we just have to clarify a few points.  So there are two main areas we have to look at to answer this question. The first is, is the games industry market saturated with cryptocurrency solutions? The second is, how diverse is the games industry and how does our particular project fit into this diversification. Or in short, how is our project unique?  We have to consider that the games industry is huge. Think about how many cryptocurrency users exist, how many exchanges there are - and our crypto industry is nothing compared to the number of people playing games and revenues generated through businesses in the games industry. Just to highlight the difference in the crypto industry to the games industry - a recent benchmark study by Cambridge University suggests that there are around 5.8 million active users in crypto exchanges and up to 11.5 million active wallets.  Compare that to the games industry there is reported to be a staggering 1.2 billion people playing games globally. That means something like 1 out of every 6/7 person on the planet is a game player. Consider as well the revenues generated in this industry well exceed $106Bn and grows on average by 6.5% annually. It's just simply a massive industry with hundreds of niche areas to engage with.  Then to look at all the gaming crypto projects that are being launched - none are really in full production, none have dominated the market because it's just such a new innovative industry. You say that there are hundreds of gaming related crypto projects, but if there is really that many, how many are actually penetrating the market? We know of a small handful that are making real progress - but again they are not established. We're not saying that other crypto projects in this space are bad (as you mention some have secured partnerships) - it's just early days for this industry with massive opportunities as we all know.  So specifically where do we fit into the games industry then and how 'different' are we?  Our project is focused on developing/fostering the interactive games communities - that exist in a multitude of formats. We are creating specific solutions that doesn't just throw a product or service at gamers and developers, it has been carefully structured and crafted to create stronger unity between them. For example, one particular aspect that we are developing is addressing the issue of gamers going in breach of EULAs for games. This is lost revenue for the developers and publishers, plus is not smooth sailing for gamers that actually wish to pursue these avenues. Our solutions actually work to benefit both gamers and developers in these situations - even going so far as to improve player retention. This is just the surface, to really get into the detail it would be best to go through our white paper https://triforcetokens.io/resources/white-paper-v3.3.pdf and pitch deck https://triforcetokens.io/resources/pitch-deck-v1.4.2.pdf.  We understand the challenges faced by both sides having been involved in some external game markets myself, I can tell you there is a massive opportunity to monetise these activities, something I have yet to see other projects address.  Then comes the actual structure and ethos of the project. This is a business and we are putting things in place now that will place us in a much stronger position for future mergers and partnerships, making us more adoptable and attractive to the bigger institutions. We are advocates of positive change and are working on big challenges such as piracy and protection of players - so our vision is much more comprehensive than simple digital assets as many other projects focus on.  Hopefully this gives a little more clarity on what sets us apart? Ultimately innovation comes from those that are prepared to push the boundaries and those that have the ability to respond positively to trends - something that I know our core team has plenty of.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Well it can be argued either way really. We wanted to go with a mobile application first as the majority of the gaming community have access to a mobile device, which they use regularly throughout their day.  It made more sense to go with a mobile application first due to its ease of accessibility. Plus while playing on consoles and PC its much easier to quickly look on your phone rather than trawling through a web browser. It also means that you are able to be connected with our platform and the community at anytime, no matter where you are.  We have every intention to create a web based application of the platform also, but that won't come until later.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

This accompanies the approaching release of TriForce Tokens’s new RaidParty mobile app, planned for launch before the next token sale on February 20th, 2018.  January 3rd, 2018 Milton Keynes, UK – With the backing of Coventry University and Innovate UK, blockchain gaming tech firm TriForce Tokens continues to power ahead with its goal of creating a blockchain-based digital ecosystem for the online gaming community, with the dates for its next token sale finalized and its new mobile gaming app RaidParty close to completion.  TriForce Tokens have also recently decided to rename their token from the old name of TFT, to FORCE token.  The team behind Triforce Tokens is also working hard to raise the platform’s profile, diligently refining marketing efforts to ensure better prominence and awareness of its mission to lead the revolution of the multi-billion dollar online games industry through innovative use of blockchain technology.

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Hi littooo,  You raise some good questions. To answer the first, we conducted market surveys several months ago before we announced our project, met up with developers, gamers including in game groups. In the survey 86% of developers said that they loved the idea of the solutions we would implement. I have also been a part of external gaming 'markets' so to speak where players are offering in-game services. There is a particular route that can be beneficial to both gamers and developers, without gamers being in breach of the developers/publishers EULA agreements. This is where our solutions fit in.  Our target audience is all defined in our white paper and pitch decks plus we have strong partners in this industry including Vadim Bulatov, our games industry adviser who is head of marketing at wargaming.net. We are still a young start-up project but already have impressive connections and growing our community of followers. As for going out through relevant gaming community publications, it would only make sense for us to do this once our technology is deployed in a production environment or in the lead up to it, which I hope you can appreciate. This forms part of our next four year growth strategy.  I hope I have given you enough clarification to your questions.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: HAPPY NEW YEAR!  WE HERE AT TRIFORCE TOKENS WOULD LIKE TO WISH YOU ALL A PROSPEROUS NEW YEAR!  Apologise for the drop in levels of communication, many of the team have been spending time with their family and friends over the holidays. However, we are all back on the scene now.  We are all very excited and are eagerly waiting to see what this year brings. We have lots planned for this year and with all of your support, we hope to make this the best year yet.  Not long now until our next token sale event, 20th FEB! - Make sure you have registered your interest via our website: https://triforcetokens.io/   What can you expect at the start of this year?  BETA release of our Social Engagement Platform coming to mobile devices. Our team are working hard on getting this ready for you guys to test and use as soon as possible. Expected date of arrival of BETA is early to mid FEB.  We will become Cyber Essentials Plus certified towards the start of this year, with our ISO27001 certification coming after. Meaning our data and our clients data will be more secure, with policies and procedures in place to prevent attacks.  Our smart contracts are nearly ready, we can expect to see them within the next month. They will be public for your viewing. They are currently being tested and tweaked, we will have an update for you all soon. Expected date of arrival mid to late JAN.  Of course our token sale events, we have our next token sale event starting 20th FEB. Be sure you don't miss out on that as the discounts and bonuses will NOT be the same again.  We plan on doing more live streamed QnA's this year, to give you guys and the wider community an opportunity to find out who we are and what we're really about.  We plan on expanding our team and our relationships within the community. We aim to bring on bigger names and more prominent players within the gaming industry and that of the crypto industry.  And much more! Be sure to check out our white paper for our plans and road map - https://triforcetokens.io/resources/white-paper-v3.3.pdf   Show your support!  Make sure you show your support for TriForce Tokens and our project this year, and the years to come by following and subscribing to our social media channels.  FaceBook - https://www.facebook.com/triforcetokens/  Twitter - https://twitter.com/TriForceTokens  Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/triforcetokens/  YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCzXH1e2bclPu8NkuM1yICfg/featured  Medium - https://medium.com/@triforcetokens  Also don't forget you can join us on Telegram!  Telegram - https://t.me/TriForceTokens   Thank you!  We would like to thank you all for your support of our project and vision and we hope to keep your support throughout this year and for the years to come.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: We are currently working towards our ISO27001 certification yes. The definition is as follows:  ISO 27001 (formally known as ISO/IEC 27001:2005) is a specification for an information security management system (ISMS). An ISMS is a framework of policies and procedures that includes all legal, physical and technical controls involved in an organisation's information risk management processes.  Source: http://whatis.techtarget.com/definition/ISO-27001  It basically ensures that we have the correct policies and procedures in place to protect our and our clients data and information. It helps us to understand the areas of weakness, so that be can better protect ourselves from attacks. The benefits are that we as a company will do regular checks to ensure that our technology is protected and that we have procedures in place, if an attack takes place. It gives peace of mind not only to use as a company that we are best prepared for attacks, but also for our clients and consumers to ensure that their data and information is secure.  Its is standard practice now for many IT related businesses.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes, we are currently working on our Anti-piracy engine. This piece of technology will be designed to help minimise piracy within the gaming industry and making it more profitable for game developers where possible.  We are working closely with Coventry University on this to help better understand why people pirate games, to ensure we combat it in the best possible ways.  The engine is designed to notify the game developer that a user is using a pirated copy of their game. The system will prompt the developers with options to which they can take. So for example an option might be, to send the user of the pirated copy a message to alert them that the developers are aware and that they will allow them to continue you trailing their game for a set amount of days. At the end of that trail period, the developers could then potentially offer the user a discounted version of the game so that no revenue is lost. Please be aware that this is just an example, we are working with Coventry University on this to ensure that we provide the best possible solutions for the game developers.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: DirkDiggler1911
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Ah,ye makes sense,thnx for explanation,im not really software guy

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: There is no reason why that wouldn't be possible. Once we release our technology and integration kits however, it is then down to the developers to which games they would like to integrate the technology into. So unfortunately we cannot say for definite. Although, I am sure that if the demand for it is high enough, I am sure they would.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes, we have systems in place to ensure that data is saved in case of certain situations.  I know how frustrating that can be, especially if you have just completed something that has take you a while to do and the servers drop or your connection goes causing you to lose all of what you had just done.  But yes, our development team will ensure some form of backup technology to ensure data and information is safely secured.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Well, you would be really surprised how many technology companies don't get certified or even consider it. It provides a really robust framework, that can be difficult to achieve, and in fact would cost a lot more to implement if left for further down the road, than by implementing it early on. So a company who understands the value and importance of this, can implement it much easier early on - then as the company grows they already have a strategy and standard practice to follow. It opens the doors to a lot more partnership opportunities too with much larger organisations. Some will actually not be able to engage with a company that does not meet these standards.  So in short, there is much more to be gained from simply protecting peoples information, systems and data (although extremely important in Todays climate of IT attacks) - it paves the way for larger networking/business opportunities.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: I assume you are messing around here..  But just to clarify a point on this - we have to be careful on casting such a wide net. In business, sometimes it is more productive to focus on more niche areas - to capture that low hanging fruit. Of course, we have really big ambitions don't get me wrong. There is so much opportunity out there for our tech, even from one small part of what we are building.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: It's a good question and sorry for the delay on answering this one guys. I needed to discuss with the dev team to get a clear and definitive answer:  Ok, so as you expect when purchasing tokens you would have to own/buy ETH as part of the token sales. However, inside our own actual applications we will have a dedicated service that will mean users will not have to own any ETH inside the application to conduct trades/transfer of our tokens. This service will take care of the ETH transaction fees on behalf of the users, with a transaction fee in FORCE tokens.  Btw we are going with a new currency ticker symbol (FORCE) instead of TFT - because we discovered some really old redundant coin was using this symbol on EtherDelta. We could have continued to use it however we made the decision to avoid any conflict down the road, plus our new symbol is much more fitting to our project.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes this is an excellent idea. We had not formally documented it but it will certainly form part of our strategy.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: There would be no need for more than $60m. $60m is more than enough for us to execute all of our plans with plenty of budget left. It would be greedy and pointless for us to take more than we need. We want to show the community that believe in our products and services and truly believe in helping to re-shape and revolution the gaming industry. We aren't in this just for the money. We're in this because we care and are passionate about our technology and our vision.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Its quite difficult to estimate things like that due to unforeseen changes that take place within the crypto world. But what I can tell you is that our soft cap is still set at $500,000. This is enough to execute our plans, but it will mean they will be more towards the basic end of the scale. The more we raise, the better our technology will not only look, but perform. We want to provide technology that revolutionises the gaming industry, so the more support the community provides, the faster and more efficient we will be at doing so.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Hi titovnn,  We do get asked this question quite a lot. I am putting a full content piece together on it because there is a real myriad of points to address with why we are unique and why the gaming industry is attracting many crypto projects. In short though, consider how many blockchain projects there are and the size of this industry. Now compare that to the global games industry, where 1 in 5 people globally are playing some kind of game. The blockchain industry pales in comparison to the gaming industry and people claim there are so many 'gaming tokens'. In terms of size I would argue there are far more exchanges for crypto compared to the market size as opposed to blockchain games industry solutions for the games industry.  Hopefully this makes a little sense?  But the clear differentiators that set us apart is the technology stack being deployed, the honorary system, how tokens can be utilised with regards to player to player rewarding. Our token capitalises on actual in-game activities not just simple digital assets.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Stress tests are done programmatically although, yes part of the idea of a beta release is to discover what happens through real user interactions and get feedback from the community.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: btcltcdigger
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: How come you've decided to do a token on ETH blockchain, instead of creating your own custom blockchain?

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Good question. There are obviously pros and cons for both. The primary reason is we don't need to re-invent the wheel plus we can focus resources on other key areas of the business. For us the blockchain tech represents one layer in the complete technology stack being built, so it makes more sense to use something that already exists, provides the capabilities we need and has already gone through many live scenarios with other projects.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Well we would remain in beta until we are satisfied a full stable production release could be launched. When I have launched other applications before they tend to be at this stage after several weeks, but no longer than 6 months. Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Really good question. There are several things that we are going to put in place to protect against a massive sell-off at the end of the token sales. Of course it's not possible to 'stop' people selling right after, however there are a few things that will be done to protect against it. Like many of you I find it frustrating that some ICO's can end up being bought cheaper right after the token sales. So here is our plan:  Our own team, advisers and investors agreed to a staggered plan of releasing their token share over several months. No massive sell-off will occur from the project team guaranteed. We have implemented a staggered supply to discount ratio that reduces the number of tokens available at higher discount levels - so the largest portion of the supply would need to be sold at a loss to depreciate the token value further A solid buy wall will be put in place at a determined level to ensure value does not depreciate further than the lowest token value of the token sales Finally, we have a plan of consistent project updates and progress to ensure a healthy and proactive community exists beyond the token sale - we really are going for that real world adoption and have the right team that will ensure this happens. It takes more than just attracting the crypto community for a truly viable project to grow and we understand that.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Please consider that our token is a pure utility/protocol token. Our project meets the current regulatory standards here in the UK and when you join the project, you are in fact contributing to it in exchange for a usable token. However, you should still check with your Countries rules around joining in our project, considering the above. I am not aware of issues with Indonesia preventing people taking part in token sales.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes this was actually in regards to our applications, not the token sale, in terms of protecting developers/publishers. It's a competitive edge that we have in the market being able to protect them against volatility. With regards to the token sale, we do have a buy back policy to prevent the same, please see my last comment above.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Body: Yes, since it is a standard ERC-20 token there will be the ability to withdraw to any wallet address that the user wishes.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Good question. Inside our applications and network, price will be determined by all users on that network. So it will effectively be the community that determines the price, but using our internal exchange systems. Of course, when it is listed on other exchanges people will be able to trade on those. Our primary focus is to deliver on real world user adoption - and the audiences we are targeting are not necessarily going to understand the crypto world and how to actually buy from exchanges. So our systems will simplify this process for them and it will be done through simple User Interfaces that non-crypto people can use.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes another great question. The transaction fee's will be determined by the application owner (game developers). Any transaction fees will be transparent and visible to all users who will need to confirm they accept it. So this will discourage bad actors from putting in massive fees. We are considering putting a limiter on it, however this can only be determined through real world testing. It wouldn't make sense for us to say "It will be fixed at a maximum of 10%" because in the real world, the community will lead on that decision.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: No exchanges have been planned yet. We are focusing on our technology at the moment to ensure it is ready and up to scratch for launch. After our token sale event, we will look into exchanges. Please note however that exchanges are not our priority. Gaining real user adoption of our technology and our token in our technology is our main focus, as this is what will increase the value of the token. We have no issue with people trading our token on the exchanges, however it will not increase its value, if it does, by marginal amounts compared to user adoption.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Each coin will have its own 'Best' strategy. Its not as simple as just saying hold off for all coins as it will only work for some. Others you are betting off investing as your return would be greater. You need to do your own research on the coins and study their behaviours in order to make your own decision.  Pete Mardell, CEO is currently working on some content for the entire crypto community that will help shed some light on some of these issues. I will also help explain things to new-comers to the crypto world and will also help those who want to get started in it.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Hi MrSlave,  I think you are referring to the number of full time devs we have (there are others who are not full time and contracted). There are a host of others that are involved as you can see on our website plus we also have specific contractors that aren't listed on the website. Bare in mind we have a solid plan to upscale which includes setting up offices at Coventry University Technology Park from the funds that are raised. We have also recently partnered with an award winning marketing agency, so in some cases it's actually better to set up contractors who specialise in certain areas to advance the project.  We are being very open and transparent about our operations because we personally believe trust is very important especially in this industry.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Our plans have changed slightly and our original post is something that will be updated soon. We plan is still similar, its rather just the dates that have changed. This is due to changes that have happened within the company that has allowed us to ensure that we will be better prepared for our next token sale and provide better than promised products and services.  We are still looking to bring on office space and further employees, however this now will take place after the token sale events once we have raised the funding to do so.  Just so you are aware, we have already visited the office space that we will be choosing to move to which is based at Coventry University, within the Technology park next to some extremely innovative organisations. One in particular is SGI (Serious Games Institute), a huge player in the gaming research industry.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Down the road yes. We will definitely look into the eports market, whether it will be a sponsorship or not, I am not too sure yet. Either way we plan to gain exposure in that market also. It will most likely happen after this token sale, to ensure we have the funding to do so.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Body: The beta will be released on mobile only to start with. So iOS and Android only, we will introduce Windows later on down the line. Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: No not directly at the moment. It is something we look at doing in the future however. At the moment we are just focusing on getting ourselves ready for the next token sale so we can provide what we have promised to date.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Not at the moment, we have a very basic prototype that is more for show if anything. However, we will have our beta platform ready for you guys in Feb 2018.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: We are not focusing on mobile games, our platform beta will be released on mobile for easy access for all in Feb 2018, but we are not focusing on just the mobile gaming platform. Our project focuses on bringing all platforms (PC, Mobile, Playstation, Xbox & Nintendo) together under one roof.  But yes, we are looking at creating merchandise early to mid next year. We are thinking more along the lines of t-shirts and hats at the moment, but if our community likes our images and merchandise there is no reason why we couldn't create other items too. Like phone cases, mouse matts etc.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Maybe in the future, but not as of yet. At the moment we need to create real user adoption. Slapping people in the face with a membership fee straight away is extremely likely to scare them off. Once we have a real user base, then we can introduce memberships/licences etc which will grant benefits or bonuses.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Maybe, but its a big maybe. We are currently focusing on the social side of it at the moment. We are currently in the process of building the group finder part of it, so helping you to locate other players who want to do similar things within a game. For example, lets say you wanted to do the raid in Destiny 2 but you only have you and your friend. You could post out a request in the group finder to which people could reply. You can break down your request to platform, Age (+18), Mic and many more. You will also be able to build your own profile, add your friends and connect, chat and share. There is potentially a game that you may be able to try it out on, but I can't promise it will be ready for the Beta release.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation) are the new data protection laws that are coming into play. Its huge and everyone has to be compliant with it. I have provided a link below that explains it in further detail if you would like to know more about it:  http://www.itpro.co.uk/it-legislation/27814/what-is-gdpr-everything-you-need-to-know-8  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: No they are not locked into only games, people can use them throughout our technology such as our anti-piracy engine (We will take payment in our own TFTs). You don't need to like games or use any of our technology to own or exchange our tokens, anyone can own them. We as a company, TriForce Tokens are just focusing our efforts to ensure that our tokens are used in the way that they were designed to be used, rather than only on the exchanges. We don't have a problem with people buying and selling on the exchanges, but only true value will come from user adoption. Which is what we are focusing on creating.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: The next Token Sale Event is set to take place on the 20th February 2018, yes. We understand that we have held back on the sales, but this is for good reasoning. It has only been 3 months extra, not half a year. We have held back due to changes within the company, such as bringing new people on board and changes to our plans and strategies. There was no point in us rushing into another token sale if things weren't ready. By pushing it back, we can ensure that we are ready and have the right things in place.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: That is something that we have been thinking about and looking into. Maybe after our next token sale event we can look at creating some for you guys.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Hi everyone, just been catching up on all the comments as have been out of the country with limited internet for a few days.  Jake has been providing excellent answers to your questions. If anything you asked hasn't been covered though, feel free to reply to me and I will answer.  I did notice a couple that I would like to just cover:   from: TOKIA    We have four full time devs working on a variety of technology solutions we are offering, and then we have several other contractors to assist with certain aspects. We also have expert smart contract consultants auditing for us.   from: longwintershere  there are more gaming tokens ICOs than I can count  Yes there are a few. However, the number of projects operating within a certain industry does not give any credibility to whether it is a viable project or not. If you make a decision on supporting a project based on this alone, you won't be doing yourself any favours. I would recommend looking into the industry, the nuances, what the solutions being offered are, is there a market and how different is it to competitors to make a more informed decision. I can tell you there are solutions we are working on that no others have thought of, and you will start seeing more communications relating to this as we close nearer to the token sale. Keep following us on social media..  Consider this is a $100+Bn global industry, with a small handful of genuinely unique blockchain based projects, each with their own differences. Some focus on tournaments, some on digital assets and some on community collaboration and rewards. I'll leave you to decide where we fit in  Keep 'em coming and I look forward to showing everything the team has been working on.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: Nikosgalis1957
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Apologies if I missed that info, but one which platform will you start first? Mobile, pc etc? Or it will be multi platform release?

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: No worries Nikosgalis1957. We are working on the core intelligence engine at the moment, that will be utilised across all platforms. Then we will deliver platform specific integration kits and at this stage I couldn't give an indication as to what platforms would come first - although since we have some partners that build for mobile games, we would likely implement mobile first.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Depends how the developers want to use the tokens. I don't think they will at first until the token builds value, but once it has a real value I don't see why you couldn't. The platform isn't being designed to sell games at the moment. That seems to be the way most ICOs are heading, crypto based game stores. But if our token takes off, which it will then sure there is no reason why you couldn't purchase a game with TFTs.  I think once our tokens have value, most developers would probably encourage players to purchase their games with cryptos as they start to realise the value of cryptos. The only issue we would come across would be of the retailers and distributors as we would then be taking a cut of their market share. SO, if we were to go down that road we would have to tread lightly and carefully.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Theres a lot more to it than just pixels and blocks  Another good game I just thought of is 'Rust', its in Beta on PC, you can get it via Steam. It looks really good, just wish I had a good enough PC to play it.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes there certainly is a lot of other gaming tokens out there. But what makes us different? Well for starters we provide technology solutions for every party within the gaming industry, not just the player, or the developer. We are providing new and unexplored revenue streams to the players, developers and streamers. We provide a P2P trading system for the players, that allows developers to take a cut (therefore not losing out). Also, we are providing the worlds first honouree system that allows players to reward each on a donation bases. Not only that, but we are also creating a social engagement platform and anti-piracy strategies and engine. We are working alongside Coventry University to conduct research into why piracy occurs and how we can prevent it. TriForce Tokens is creating an eco-system that encourages and fosters collaborative communities.  TriForce Tokens is more than just a crypto-currency, our team is dedicated and passionate and all follow the same vision. We're here for the long run, we're here to revolutionise the gaming industry.  I hope that shed some light on what makes us different. It is rather brief, so if you would like more information please feel free to check out out website and white paper linked below:  Website: https://triforcetokens.io/ White paper: https://triforcetokens.io/resources/white-paper-v3.3.pdf  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Well I posted before asking the community on their opinion but didn't get much of a response.  It would be good to get games across all popular platforms such as PC, Xbox and PS4. The games I had in mind were; Ark Survival, Minecraft and Maple Story.  But at the end of the day its also down to the community as there is no point us hosting a server if no one will play on it.  I like Ark as you can change the settings with ease, so we could do double or triple exp weekends, dino giveaways etc.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes definitely. Its just a little difficult for us to do single player games at the moment as anyone could just screenshot anyone elses score and say its there own. We have no real control over it. Where as if we were to host a server in Ark for example, we have full control over the sever and its settings we will know if someone has been cheating. At the end of the day we want everyone to have a good time, but it to be fair also.  Once we have got some of the technology out of the way, we will be sure to hold more gaming events that will include single player games. I like the idea of tetris competition.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Just to add to this...  I have just spoken with Pete Mardell (CEO), we will only be accepting Ether in the next token sale so the prices for tokens will be fixed to Ether at the time of purchase. For those of you in the pre-sale, the tokens you received for your contribution are fixed to the prices of the coins you contributed with at the time. It wouldn't make sense in giving people extra to compensate the increase in value; if the prices suddenly decreased in value it would only be fair to remove and redistribute tokens according to the new value. This way, when you contribute you can be sure of what you will receive in return.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes exactly, no one knows what the price is going to be over the next few days, weeks or months. I mean even when I started working with TriForce Tokens everyone was talking about Bitcoin was at an all time high of $4,000 per coin. Now its at now at $16,000! Thats in the space of 3 months? - Insane!  I mean yes it would be nice to receive extra, but then again if its just a bubble and it crashes tomorrow, its only fair that we then re-evaluate and remove tokens. So its that deciding factor of what works best. Keeping it at purchased value ensure that everyone can be sure of what they will receive and that it wont drop or increase unexpectedly.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Exactly, thats why we have chosen to stick to Ether, just seems a little bit more stable and predictable compared to BTC. Plus due to the rate at which BTC is rising, I can't imagine many people wanting to part with them.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: We aren't looking at any exchanges at the minute. As explained before, our main focus at the moment is on our technology and making sure it does what we have promised. Also our main aim or goal if you will with our token, is for it to be used within our technology, not to be sold on the exchanges. This is due to the value of the token increasing if there is real user adoption behind it. We have no problem with people selling them on the exchange, but that is not our main aim or goal. We will most likely be looking at exchanges after our February token sale event.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Coinpayments are the Escrow for our project. You can check them out here: https://www.coinpayments.net/  No they will be taking payment after the next token sale event, which was the agreement.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: The player behavioural analysis will tracker all players as a whole, whether it will be in real time or not I am not sure, I'll have to check with our developers. The data will be shown and presented as the entire community or for a particular game, genre or group. No personal date will be shown nor will anyone be able to single out one persons behaviour analysis. We are actively working on being compliant with the new GDPR regulations and there will be protecting everyones data.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Sorry also to add to my reply and to answer your question better...  We are not really tracking players progress, more their behaviours and how the react and respond to a game. For example if someone plays a game they really dislike, they will play it once for maybe 30 minutes and then never again. From this we can tell that a player didn't enjoy the game.  Lower end PC's, consoles, mobile devices won't really have an affect on the data produced as our technology will be designed to receive data from any device regarding its specifications.  I hope that better answers your question.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: I think there will be a fine line between the economies of the game and the TFT network. Of course we don't want our technology to ruin a game or its economy, so we will be working closely with developers once we have our integration kits ready to ensure we keep economies stable and fair. It will also be down to the developers as well on how they want it to work, in a sense we just provide the technology and the rest is down to the developers. As for example some games don't already have PvP trading but they may want to implement it, therefore the only economy will be within the TFT network for that game. Some developers may want to switch there PvP trading solely to the TFT network. Regardless of what they choose, we will work with the developers to ensure it works seamlessly and doesn't disrupt any economies.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀

Body: We work out whats best for the company and go from there. Its not really something we are able to disclose as I am sure many people would rather not have that information public. Its also not really in the company's interest to public state what influencers are being paid and the methods of payment.  We only bring influencers who are right for the company and we can agree on a fair and reasonable payment agreement. We have turned influencers down due to the payment agreement there were after. However that is all I am able to disclose.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: We will not be accepting in-game credits/tokens/coins or any form of in-game currency in exchange for our tokens at this stage. Maybe further down the line once we have real user adoption. There would be no reason why players couldn't exchange in-game currencies for our tokens between each other however.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: We enjoy doing giveaways so there will be more to come for sure. We were also thinking of holding little competitions within certain games for chances to win prizes of some sort. However these will not be taking place until next year as we are focusing on our technology, solutions and marketing at the moment to ensure we have enough hype for the next token sale event.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: The Ledger Nano S giveaway has ended. We will be doing future giveaways and competitions though, but not until next year now.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: I thought it would be great if the community could play alongside the team here at TriForce Tokens. Would be a great way to get to know the team a little better and get to ask any questions you wanted live. We would also hold competitions with the games to which people could win prizes.  We would just need to know what games people would like us to host our own servers on and on what platforms.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: What are peoples thoughts on us (TriForce Tokens) hosting some of our own game servers within some games?  I have just recently got back into playing Ark Survival on the Xbox and thought it would be great to have our own server just for the TriForce Tokens community.  Other games we were thinking of were; Minecraft & Maple Story  If you guys can think of other games that allow you to host your own dedicated servers, let us know.  We also have to take into account the platforms we choose to host the servers on. It would be good if we could have a server on each platform for at least one game so that everyone could join.  This is just an idea, but I thought I would get our communities ideas on this, so let us know!  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀

If the project, as far as I understand it, is rewarding the game with its own token, we can say yes. Also the behavior analysis logic of the player is also very well thought out. People who play online games sometimes know that you are a child, but when you complain about swearing, you can not apply any penalty sanction most of the time. Or you are getting rid of the nonsense, even if you are unfair. I hope this is a robust project that can bring solutions to these issues, because if these problems are thrown away, the game world will become professionalized and this will happen thanks to blockchain technology ..

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: No the tokens can be exchanged outside of games also. Our tokens will also be used within our anti-piracy engine and within our social engagement platform also. We are just focusing on real user adoption of the tokens and our technology, so our aim is for the tokens to be used in our technology and solutions rather than just sold or traded within the exchanges. We have no problem with people trading or selling them within the exchanges, but we are focusing on what the areas that will increase the value of tokens which is real user adoption.   ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: A lot of ICOs unfortunately have been money grabbing schemes, with no real intention of actually producing anything. Which is rather annoying for the rest of the ICOs that are genuine, they're creating a bad name for the crypto space and industry. However, the industry is still strong and we have no intention of stopping until we succeed and help revolution the gaming industry. We are here to prove that blockchain technology and cryptos are the future and will help revolutionise not only the gaming industry, but the world.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀

I wont be able to exchange tokens for gold (unless its real gold we are talking? ), but hey, once our social engagement platform is up and running, thats what its there you. You will be able to sell your gold and other in-game items in exchange for tokens. Not to mention, if user adoption of the tokens increases so will the value of tokens  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes, another gaming token But hey, we promise to revolution the industry. Many other gaming ICOs have had good ideas, but poor execution and I'd argue that a lot of there market research was also fairly poor. Yes gamers want a way to earn money, but most ICOs out there are only allowing for minor crypto gains in exchange for playing hours of a game that doesn't necessarily interest the gamer. We want gamers to continue playing the games they love, whilst complimenting them with potential revenue streams, a social engagement platform, player-to-player trading and the worlds first honouree system. A system that encourages and fosters positive and collaborative gaming behaviour within the gaming community. Not only that, but we are working closely with Coventry University, researching piracy within the gaming industry so that we can provide state of the art technology to help combat and minimise it.  So I guess you could say we are just another gaming tokens, but we here at TriForce Tokens are more than just a crypto-currency, we are a passionate team focussed on our vision of revolutionising the industry.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: I can tell you about some of them yes. There are others that we are still in negotiation with, so I am unable to disclose much about them unfortunately.  Aida Alexie - Our new International Communications manager, Aida is helping us with the translation of our website, whitepaper and other documentation. Aida speaks fluently in English, French, Spanish and Romanian, with a little Russian. With her marketing background, she is also helping us to better understand the different cultures of many of these other countries so that we can better suit our marketing to those audiences.  Vadim Bulatov - Our new gaming industry advisor, Vadim is helping us to better understand the gaming industry and how to conduct marketing within it. From a gaming background himself, Vadim is an extremely value asset to TriForce Tokens. Vadim is then head of SMM for the games World of Tanks, World of Warships and World of Warplanes; some massively popular F2P games. Vadim has helped increase the player count of these and many other games by the millions.  Regarding the development team our CTO Raza is current in negotiation with a few people regarding working on our technology such as our social engagement platform and integration kits. However, until this is finalised and agreed, I am unable to say much more.  There are others who we are finalising with at the moment, which we will make an announcement of upon joining the team.  But what I can tell you, is that we are currently in negotiation with someone hugely prominent within the blockchain industry. Bringing them on board will be a game changer for TriForce Tokens. But, that is all that I am able to disclose at this moment in time.  It's all coming together. As always, once we have some big news we will be sure to share it with you all.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: The reasons for the delay is due to changes within the company and the new people we have brought on board. We want to ensure that the company is successful not only for ourselves, but for the contributors also. We have been working on new things that we believe will ensure the company's success. These things include bringing on prominent people within the gaming industry, our new social engagement platform and a new marketing partnership.  We are currently working on updating our website and bounty campaign so that we can provide everyone with the new and correct information. The reason for choosing to hold back on the next token sale until Feb 2018, is because we believe people are starting to wind down due to the holidays being around the corner. It makes more sense to wait it out and give everyone time to get back into the swing of things. It will also allow us enough time to get our beta version of our social engagement platform ready for launch and time to build up further hype and user adoption.  I hope that answers your question?  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: I don't believe its in our initial scope due to the popularity of the games usually. The main scope of games that we will be targeting are more along the lines of MMOs and MMORPGs. This is due to all of our technology being relevant within most of those types of games.  We will never rule out a game or a genre of game, so somewhere down the line family games can and will be introduced if they fit.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Thats a very good idea.  We have recently acquired a new marketing partnership with a company who has won many digital marketing awards. They have created a strategic plan for us which incorporates quite a few things that we believe will massively improve our image within both the gaming industry and the blockchain/crypto industries.  I will raise your idea within the team and our marketing partner, it is something we will keep in mind for sure.  We are always very grateful to hear your ideas and thoughts on how we can improve, so keep them coming!  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes, I believe it all started with the new Star Wars Battlefield 2. Regardless of what game it is however, these development companies are making extraordinary amounts of $$$ from gamers for cosmetic items that have very little if not no affect on your gameplay.  I believe Activision was also caught out with a system that had in place that encouraged players to purchase loot crates by matching players with loot crate items with those that didn't. Destiny 2 is a great example of the system.  Thats why we here at TriForce Tokens believe that the players also need a way of generating a little extra income from the games they love and enjoy. Especially if they are forking out so much money not only on purchasing the game, but then within the game also.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: I have no problem with loot crates, I just feel that in many cases they can be unfair in the sense of what you receive for money. Trove was my example as many YouTubers have created videos on purchasing in game loot crates and receiving around 1-2 good and worthy items from around $150 spent.  I think the issue that countries/governments are having with the loot crates system are because young children playing games are easily able to make these in-game purchases without a real concept of how much they are spending and what the get in return. Hence the gambling aspect of it, people are paying money for a chance to receive a good item. It is therefore arguably, encouraging gambling from a young age.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes we need to look at the bigger picture. From my own experience of buying into cryptos, I always look at projects that have a longer term strategy and something that has a viable business or economic model, and this strategy has served me well. That isn't to say that is the only thing to consider or to exclude other projects that don't meet those standards, it's just something that has worked for me. Obviously since focusing a lot more on this project I haven't been as involved in the investment side.  Bearing this in mind and my experiences within fast growing companies, those with a longer term vision perform much better, hence why I have insisted our project has a minimum 4 year detailed plan to execute. So if you believe in our vision and that we will deliver it, join now and grow with us.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Ok so this is a particular topic around ICOs and token sales. Our's is a token sale, not an official coin offering. The terminology is important, because if a project falls under an "investment security" it is then likely to need much more stringent regulation around the activities and how it goes about raising funds. If it falls under a security it makes it very difficult to conduct a token sale and in fact could be at risk of legal repocusions if regulations are not adhered to.  There is actually a "howey test" that can be done to determine the likely hood if a crypto-currency would fall under a security. We completed ours which determined there is a low chance of our project being considered a security - meaning we can avoid a lot of the legal implications. Our report is at the following link: https://github.com/TriForceNetwork/TriForceTokens-WhitePaper/blob/master/Securities%20Law%20Framework%20for%20Blockchain%20Tokens.pdf  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Glad to see you understand the wide reaching positivity this can bring to the industry. It's actually about encouraging people to collaborate together in game, helping each other improve their skills in competitive games, levelling up, completing raids together.. Punishing players for bad behaviour just doesn't really work, as we all know you can just simply start again. If someone get's punished what you tend to find is they double-down on their behaviour. So it's much better to have a system that rewards positive behaviour. We see this happening with popular titles already.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Hi, good question. We see ourselves as completely different from both Electroneum, as well as many of our other competitors. We aim to provide real solutions to the gaming industry, solutions that benefit everyone within the industry and community. From the developer to the gamer, everyone that is within the TriForce Tokens network will be able to benefit from its technology and its solutions.  Although we don't have 'mining', we allow developers to set tasks/quests from players that grants players rewards in the form of our own crypto-currency upon completion. So in a sense, I guess you could argue that would be mining to a degree? We also allow players to trade between one another, as well as honour each other through the worlds first honouree system. The system will allow players to send/donate real crypto-currency (TFT - our currency) to others as a form of gratitude or in exchange of services.  We are also currently building a anti-piracy engine. Working alongside Coventry University, we aim to help bring piracy down to a more manageable level for game development companies. We are also currently building a social engagement platform for the gaming community, that will bring the entire community under one roof, regardless of the platforms you play on. We aim to have a beta version of the social engagement platform ready for our community by Feb 2018.  I hope this answered your question? If you still want to know more about TriForce Tokens, I strongly suggest checking out our website and our whitepaper. I will provide links below for you.  Website: https://triforcetokens.io/ Whitepaper: https://triforcetokens.io/resources/white-paper-v3.3.pdf  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: We are first targeting the indie game sector. We have no intention to stop there however, so do not be disheartened.  We are wanted to start with the indie game sector as we felt that many indie developers have struggled to get their games played and noticed. Our entire ethos if you will is all about helping the gaming community to grow and expand, but through incorporating everyone, not just the big boys with the large amounts of $$$.  As a PS4 and Xbox One gamer myself, we have every intention to break into those markets also. So fear not! We are working on it.  ~ Jake Ashby, TriForce Tokens General Manager

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes that is very true. However, mobile games are becoming increasingly more popular, games such a Clash of Clans, Game of War etc, have thousands if not millions of players. We want to build a platform that brings everyone together, not to mention most people that play PC or Console games are more than likely to also play mobile games. The idea of the platform is to bring everything under one roof, so that you are able to communicate with your friends and the community all at once regardless of what platform you or they're on.  However the platform doesn't just end there. Our ideas and plans for the platform expand much further than just multi-platform communication. P2P trading, worlds first honouree system, developer's ability to set quests and task for TFT rewards, tournaments, group finding etc etc. The possibilities for this platform are endless.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes the idea is to also allow the players to create a revenue stream. This can be done by item trading, selling services or via honouring.  The idea is also to help encourage and foster a more positive gaming community, which is why we have created the honouring system. This system will allow players to 'honour' (donate or send TFTs) one another, for whatever they see fit.  An example might be, Destiny 2 for example. Someone is struggling to complete the raid, so, they use our platform to find others willing to help. With the help of others, they complete the raid. The player who seeked help could then reward the assisting players with TFT as a sign of gratitude.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: Victorio
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: mrpetem, After reading the WP, I did not understand how is realized the ownership transfer. Say we have Player A, who wants to sell a gold AK47 in PUBG for 10 TFT and Player B who wants to buy it. What is the role of TriForce here? Does Player A have to transfer manually the AK47 to Player B and TriForce smart contract makes the TFT settlement, after checking the inventory at Player B side or does the TriForce application automatically transfer AK47 from A to B and TFT from B to A? From my understanding, both scenarios require TriForce to call the API of the game and you will need to work with game developers. What game genres will be a priority for your project?  I can recall at least 2 similar ICOs - Dmarket and Firstblood. Firstblood hasn't yet delivered nothing valuable, but weekly tournaments for DOTA 2. Can't comment on Dmarket. Will certainly look for updates from you!

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Hi Victorio,  It's a great question. There are a couple of methods this will be handled:  First, through integration kits that are being developed for the various gaming platforms will allow developers to connect to the entire TriForce Tokens ecosystem, allowing players to interact on the network. This would mean confirmation of delivery of items or interaction is built into the game. The second method will be via honouring and an in-built escrow implementation, that will mean both parties accept or decline the transaction upon completion. The honouring aspect will show trustworthy players much similar to an ebay style rating, that is publicly viewable. The finer details are being worked out atm.  Hope this helps.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yes exactly, one step at a time. We need to stay focused on the task at hand first. Once we have that completed, by all means we will be looking at ways to improve and offer more. We are always grateful for our communities support and input.  Yes, the idea of the social engagement platform is to break those boundaries that stop players of different platforms from communicating. We want to create a social hub that brings everyone within the gaming community together under one roof, regardless of the platform you play on. The idea is also to help those that have multiple platforms, stay in touch and in the loop with their friends and community while they play on their other platforms.  Myself for example, I have both the PlayStation 4 and the Xbox One. I play with a different group of friends on each platform, and it can be hard at times to keep in touch with everyone at the same time. So, we wanted to create a place that allows us to communicate with everyone, regardless of where you are and what platform you are on.  ~ Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens

Author: mrpetem
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: Yeah as others have mentioned, any closed off system that doesn't allow indie developers is not really going to fit into our market. There's such a huge market as it is with just indie games, even securing 1% of the market share would produce millions in revenue. As for Nintendo switch, it does allow for indie games to be developed so our technology will be available to integrate into them. As for whether we create specific integration kits would be based on further in depth market research. Our first goals will be to capture the low hanging fruit.  ~ Pete Mardell, CEO TriForce Tokens

Author: Destined2bGreat
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: In what countries do you plan to open offices?

Author: JCBAHY
Title: ⚡ [ANN] ⚡ TriForce Tokens Gaming ⚡ [ICO Escrowed] 🚀 Industry Partnerships 🚀
Body: As we are first targeting our technology to the EU and US markets, we will first be opening an office here in the UK. Once our following and user adoption increases and we become established within the markets, we plan to expand the to cover the Asian market also. So to begin with our HQ if you will, will be based here in the UK with potential of opening further offices in other countries if we need to.  ~  Jake Ashby, General Manager TriForce Tokens
